intro: Sabatia purpusii, commonly known as Purpus's sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in sandy or calcareous soils and thrives in sunny, coastal environments. It is part of the tribe Verbenae, which includes many species with showy, often brightly colored flowers. Sabatia purpusii is also notable for its ability to tolerate salt spray and coastal winds, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
